content: 1 The first narrative indeed､ made I, concerning all things, O Theophilus, which Jesus began both to do and teach,—
content_old: 1 The first narrative indeed､ made I, concerning all things, O Theophilus, which Jesus began both to do and teach,—

content: 2 until the day when having given command unto the apostles､ whom through Holy Spirit he had chosen he was taken up;
content_old: 2 until the day when having given command unto the apostles､ whom through Holy Spirit he had chosen he was taken up;

content: 3 unto whom he also presented himself alive､ after he had suffered､ by many sure tokens, throughout forty days making himself visible unto them､ and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God.
content_old: 3 unto whom he also presented himself alive､ after he had suffered､ by many sure tokens, throughout forty days making himself visible unto them､ and speaking the things concerning the kingdom of God.

content: 4 And being in company with them he charged them､ from Jerusalem not to absent themselves, but— To abide around the promise of the Father which ye have heard of me,
content_old: 4 And being in company with them he charged them､ from Jerusalem not to absent themselves, but— To abide around the promise of the Father which ye have heard of me,

content: 5 Because John indeed､ immersed with water; But ye in Holy Spirit shall be immersed,— After not many of these days.
content_old: 5 Because John indeed､ immersed with water; But ye in Holy Spirit shall be immersed,— After not many of these days.

content: 6 They therefore, having come together began to question him, saying— Lord! art thou at this time duly establishing the kingdom unto Israel?
content_old: 6 They therefore, having come together began to question him, saying— Lord! art thou at this time duly establishing the kingdom unto Israel?

content: 7 He said unto them— It is not yours to get to know times or seasons which the Father hath put in his own authority;
content_old: 7 He said unto them— It is not yours to get to know times or seasons which the Father hath put in his own authority;

content: 8 But ye shall receive power､ when the Holy Spirit cometh upon you, and ye shall be my witnesses､ both in Jerusalem and in all Judæa and Samaria､ and as far as the uttermost part of the land.
content_old: 8 But ye shall receive power､ when the Holy Spirit cometh upon you, and ye shall be my witnesses､ both in Jerusalem and in all Judæa and Samaria､ and as far as the uttermost part of the land.

content: 9 And having said these things as they were beholding he was lifted up, and a cloud caught him away from their eyes.
content_old: 9 And having said these things as they were beholding he was lifted up, and a cloud caught him away from their eyes.

content: 10 And while they were looking steadfastly into heaven､ as he was going his way then lo! two men had taken their stand beside them､ in white garments,—
content_old: 10 And while they were looking steadfastly into heaven､ as he was going his way then lo! two men had taken their stand beside them､ in white garments,—

content: 11 who also said— Men of Galilee! why stand ye looking into heaven? This Jesus､ who hath been taken up from you into heaven shall so come in like manner as ye yourselves have gazed upon him going into heaven.
content_old: 11 who also said— Men of Galilee! why stand ye looking into heaven? This Jesus､ who hath been taken up from you into heaven shall so come in like manner as ye yourselves have gazed upon him going into heaven.

content: 12 Then returned they into Jerusalem､ from a mountain called Olivet, which is nigh unto Jerusalem､ a Sabbath day’s journey.
content_old: 12 Then returned they into Jerusalem､ from a mountain called Olivet, which is nigh unto Jerusalem､ a Sabbath day’s journey.

content: 13 And when they had entered, into the upper-story went they up､ where remained behind—both Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphæus and Simon the zealot, and Judas the son of James.
content_old: 13 And when they had entered, into the upper-story went they up､ where remained behind—both Peter and John and James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphæus and Simon the zealot, and Judas the son of James.

content: 14 These all were giving constant attention､ with one accord､ unto the prayer, with certain women ､ and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.
content_old: 14 These all were giving constant attention､ with one accord､ unto the prayer, with certain women ､ and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren.

content: 15 And in these days Peter, standing up in the midst of the brethren, said,—and there was a multitude of names､ of one accord, about a hundred and twenty,—
content_old: 15 And in these days Peter, standing up in the midst of the brethren, said,—and there was a multitude of names､ of one accord, about a hundred and twenty,—

content: 16 Brethren! It was needful for the Scripture to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spake beforehand､ through the mouth of David, concerning Judas,—who became guide unto them who apprehended Jesus;
content_old: 16 Brethren! It was needful for the Scripture to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spake beforehand､ through the mouth of David, concerning Judas,—who became guide unto them who apprehended Jesus;

content: 17 for that he had come to be reckoned among us､ and obtained the lot of this ministry.—
content_old: 17 for that he had come to be reckoned among us､ and obtained the lot of this ministry.—

content: 18 This man therefore had possessed himself of a field out of the reward of unrighteousness,—and falling headlong burst asunder in the midst, and forth gushed all his bowels;
content_old: 18 This man therefore had possessed himself of a field out of the reward of unrighteousness,—and falling headlong burst asunder in the midst, and forth gushed all his bowels;

content: 19 and it became known unto all them who were dwelling in Jerusalem, so that that field was called､ in their language､ Akeldama, that is､ Field of Blood.—
content_old: 19 and it became known unto all them who were dwelling in Jerusalem, so that that field was called､ in their language､ Akeldama, that is､ Field of Blood.—

content: 20 For it is written in the Book of Psalms: Let his encampment become desolate, And let there be none to dwell therein! And— His overseership let a different man take!
content_old: 20 For it is written in the Book of Psalms: Let his encampment become desolate, And let there be none to dwell therein! And— His overseership let a different man take!

content: 21 It is needful then that of the men who companied with us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus came in and went out over us,
content_old: 21 It is needful then that of the men who companied with us during all the time in which the Lord Jesus came in and went out over us,

content: 22 beginning from the immersion by John until the day when he was taken up from us that a witness of his resurrection､ along with us should one of these become.
content_old: 22 beginning from the immersion by John until the day when he was taken up from us that a witness of his resurrection､ along with us should one of these become.

content: 23 And they appointed two,—Joseph､ called Barsabbas､ who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.
content_old: 23 And they appointed two,—Joseph､ called Barsabbas､ who was surnamed Justus, and Matthias.

content: 24 And､ praying､ they said— Thou Lord! observer of the hearts of all men! Shew forth whom thou hast chosen,— Of these two one;—
content_old: 24 And､ praying､ they said— Thou Lord! observer of the hearts of all men! Shew forth whom thou hast chosen,— Of these two one;—

content: 25 To take the place of this ministry and apostleship, From which Judas went aside､ to go his way unto his own place.
content_old: 25 To take the place of this ministry and apostleship, From which Judas went aside､ to go his way unto his own place.

content: 1 And when the day of pentecost was filling up the number of days they were all together with one intent;—
content_old: 1 And when the day of pentecost was filling up the number of days they were all together with one intent;—

content: 2 when there came､ suddenly､ out of heaven､ a sound, just as of a mighty rushing wind,—and it filled all the house where they were sitting;
content_old: 2 when there came､ suddenly､ out of heaven､ a sound, just as of a mighty rushing wind,—and it filled all the house where they were sitting;

content: 3 and there appeared unto them—parting asunder—tongues､ like as of fire, and it sat upon each one of them;
content_old: 3 and there appeared unto them—parting asunder—tongues､ like as of fire, and it sat upon each one of them;

content: 4 and they were all filled with Holy Spirit, and began to be speaking with other kinds of tongues､ just as the Spirit was giving unto them to be sounding forth.
content_old: 4 and they were all filled with Holy Spirit, and began to be speaking with other kinds of tongues､ just as the Spirit was giving unto them to be sounding forth.

content: 5 Now there were in Jerusalem､ sojourning Jews, reverent men､ from every nation､ who were under heaven;
content_old: 5 Now there were in Jerusalem､ sojourning Jews, reverent men､ from every nation､ who were under heaven;

content: 6 and this sound occurring the throng came together､ and was thrown into confusion, because each one severally heard in his own language､ them who were speaking;
content_old: 6 and this sound occurring the throng came together､ and was thrown into confusion, because each one severally heard in his own language､ them who were speaking;

content: 7 yea they were beside themselves､ and did marvel, saying— Lo! are not all these who are speaking､ Galilæans?
content_old: 7 yea they were beside themselves､ and did marvel, saying— Lo! are not all these who are speaking､ Galilæans?

content: 8 How then do we hear､ each one in our own language in which we were born?
content_old: 8 How then do we hear､ each one in our own language in which we were born?

content: 9 Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and those dwelling in Mesopotamia, Judæa also and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,
content_old: 9 Parthians and Medes and Elamites, and those dwelling in Mesopotamia, Judæa also and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia,

content: 10 Phrygia also and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of the Libya that is towards Cyrene, and the sojourning Romans,—both Jews and proselytes,
content_old: 10 Phrygia also and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of the Libya that is towards Cyrene, and the sojourning Romans,—both Jews and proselytes,

content: 11 Cretans and Arabians we do hear them speaking､ in our own tongues､ the magnificent things of God.
content_old: 11 Cretans and Arabians we do hear them speaking､ in our own tongues､ the magnificent things of God.

content: 12 But they were all beside themselves､ and were utterly at a loss, saying one to another— What doth this please to be?
content_old: 12 But they were all beside themselves､ and were utterly at a loss, saying one to another— What doth this please to be?

content: 13 while others in mockery were saying— With sweet wine are they drunken!
content_old: 13 while others in mockery were saying— With sweet wine are they drunken!

content: 14 But taking his stand Peter､ with the eleven lifted up his voice, and sounded out unto them— Ye men of Judæa, and all ye who are sojourning in Jerusalem! Let this unto you be known, And give ear unto my declarations;—
content_old: 14 But taking his stand Peter､ with the eleven lifted up his voice, and sounded out unto them— Ye men of Judæa, and all ye who are sojourning in Jerusalem! Let this unto you be known, And give ear unto my declarations;—

content: 15 For not, as ye suppose, are these men drunken, for it is the third hour of the day;—
content_old: 15 For not, as ye suppose, are these men drunken, for it is the third hour of the day;—

content: 16 But this is that which hath been spoken through the prophet Joel—
content_old: 16 But this is that which hath been spoken through the prophet Joel—

content: 17 And it shall be, in the last days､ saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh; And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, And your young men visions shall see､ And your elders in dreams shall dream,—
content_old: 17 And it shall be, in the last days､ saith God, I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh; And your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, And your young men visions shall see､ And your elders in dreams shall dream,—

content: 18 And even upon my men-servants and upon my maid-servants､ In those days will I pour out of my Spirit, And they shall prophesy;
content_old: 18 And even upon my men-servants and upon my maid-servants､ In those days will I pour out of my Spirit, And they shall prophesy;

content: 19 And I will set forth wonders in the heaven above, And signs upon the earth beneath,— Blood､ and fire､ and vapour of smoke:
content_old: 19 And I will set forth wonders in the heaven above, And signs upon the earth beneath,— Blood､ and fire､ and vapour of smoke:

content: 20 The sun shall be turned into darkness､ And the moon into blood,— Before the coming of the day of the Lord, the great and manifest day;
content_old: 20 The sun shall be turned into darkness､ And the moon into blood,— Before the coming of the day of the Lord, the great and manifest day;

content: 21 And it shall be— Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
content_old: 21 And it shall be— Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

content: 22 Ye men of Israel! hear these words:— Jesus the Nazarene, a man pointed out of God unto you､ by mighty works and wonders and signs, which God did through him､ in your midst, just as ye yourselves know
content_old: 22 Ye men of Israel! hear these words:— Jesus the Nazarene, a man pointed out of God unto you､ by mighty works and wonders and signs, which God did through him､ in your midst, just as ye yourselves know

content: 23 The same by the marked out counsel and foreknowledge of God given up through the hands of lawless men suspending ye slew
content_old: 23 The same by the marked out counsel and foreknowledge of God given up through the hands of lawless men suspending ye slew

content: 24 Whom God raised up, loosing the pangs of death､ inasmuch as it was not possible for him to continue held fast by it.
content_old: 24 Whom God raised up, loosing the pangs of death､ inasmuch as it was not possible for him to continue held fast by it.

content: 25 For David saith concerning him— I foresaw the Lord､ before me､ continually, Because he is on my right hand､ that I may not be shaken;
content_old: 25 For David saith concerning him— I foresaw the Lord､ before me､ continually, Because he is on my right hand､ that I may not be shaken;

content: 26 For this reason was my heart made glad､ and my tongue exulted,— Yea further even my flesh shall encamp on hope:
content_old: 26 For this reason was my heart made glad､ and my tongue exulted,— Yea further even my flesh shall encamp on hope:

content: 27 Because thou wilt not abandon my soul unto hades, Neither wilt thou give thy man of loving-kindness to see corruption;
content_old: 27 Because thou wilt not abandon my soul unto hades, Neither wilt thou give thy man of loving-kindness to see corruption;

content: 28 Thou madest known unto me paths of life, Thou wilt make me full of gladness with thy countenance.
content_old: 28 Thou madest known unto me paths of life, Thou wilt make me full of gladness with thy countenance.

content: 29 Brethren! it is allowable to say with freedom of speech unto you､ concerning the patriarch David,—That he both died､ and was buried, and his tomb is among us until this day.
content_old: 29 Brethren! it is allowable to say with freedom of speech unto you､ concerning the patriarch David,—That he both died､ and was buried, and his tomb is among us until this day.

content: 30 Being then a prophet, and knowing that with an oath God had sworn unto him of the fruit of his loins､ to seat on his throne
content_old: 30 Being then a prophet, and knowing that with an oath God had sworn unto him of the fruit of his loins､ to seat on his throne

content: 31 with foresight spake he concerning the resurrection of the Christ— That neither was he abandoned unto hades, Nor did his flesh see corruption.
content_old: 31 with foresight spake he concerning the resurrection of the Christ— That neither was he abandoned unto hades, Nor did his flesh see corruption.

content: 32 The same Jesus hath God raised up, whereof all we are witnesses!
content_old: 32 The same Jesus hath God raised up, whereof all we are witnesses!

content: 33 By the right hand of God therefore､ having been exalted, Also the promise of the Holy Spirit having received from the Father He hath poured out this which yourselves do see and hear.
content_old: 33 By the right hand of God therefore､ having been exalted, Also the promise of the Holy Spirit having received from the Father He hath poured out this which yourselves do see and hear.

content: 34 For David hath not ascended into the heavens; but he saith himself— Said the Lord unto my Lord､ Sit thou at my right hand,
content_old: 34 For David hath not ascended into the heavens; but he saith himself— Said the Lord unto my Lord､ Sit thou at my right hand,

content: 35 Until I make thy foes thy footstool.
content_old: 35 Until I make thy foes thy footstool.

content: 36 Assuredly then､ let all the house of Israel know: That both Lord and Christ hath God made him､ Even the same Jesus whom ye crucified!
content_old: 36 Assuredly then､ let all the house of Israel know: That both Lord and Christ hath God made him､ Even the same Jesus whom ye crucified!

content: 37 And when they heard this they were pricked to the heart, and said unto Peter and the rest of the apostles— What are we to do, brethren?
content_old: 37 And when they heard this they were pricked to the heart, and said unto Peter and the rest of the apostles— What are we to do, brethren?

content: 38 And Peter said unto them— Repent ye, And let each one of you be immersed､ in the name of Jesus Christ､ into the remission of your sins,— And ye shall receive the free-gift of the Holy Spirit;
content_old: 38 And Peter said unto them— Repent ye, And let each one of you be immersed､ in the name of Jesus Christ､ into the remission of your sins,— And ye shall receive the free-gift of the Holy Spirit;

content: 39 For unto you is the promise, And unto your children,— And unto all them who are afar off: As many soever as the Lord our God shall call unto him.
content_old: 39 For unto you is the promise, And unto your children,— And unto all them who are afar off: As many soever as the Lord our God shall call unto him.

content: 40 And with many different words bare he full witness, and went on exhorting them saying— Be saved from this perverse generation!
content_old: 40 And with many different words bare he full witness, and went on exhorting them saying— Be saved from this perverse generation!

content: 41 They､ therefore､ who welcomed his word were immersed; and there were added, on that day, about three thousand souls.
content_old: 41 They､ therefore､ who welcomed his word were immersed; and there were added, on that day, about three thousand souls.

content: 42 And they went on to give constant attention— Unto the teaching of the apostles､ And unto the fellowship, Unto the breaking of bread､ And unto the prayers.
content_old: 42 And they went on to give constant attention— Unto the teaching of the apostles､ And unto the fellowship, Unto the breaking of bread､ And unto the prayers.

content: 43 And there came､ on every soul､ fear, and many wonders and signs､ through means of the apostles were coming to pass.
content_old: 43 And there came､ on every soul､ fear, and many wonders and signs､ through means of the apostles were coming to pass.

content: 44 And all who believed with one accord began to hold all things common;
content_old: 44 And all who believed with one accord began to hold all things common;

content: 45 and their possessions and goods were they selling､ and distributing them unto all in so far as anyone had need.
content_old: 45 and their possessions and goods were they selling､ and distributing them unto all in so far as anyone had need.

content: 46 And daily giving attendance with one intent in the temple､ and at home breaking bread they were partaking of food with exultation and singleness of heart;
content_old: 46 And daily giving attendance with one intent in the temple､ and at home breaking bread they were partaking of food with exultation and singleness of heart;

content: 1 Now Peter and John were going up into the temple､ for the hour of prayer—the ninth;
content_old: 1 Now Peter and John were going up into the temple､ for the hour of prayer—the ninth;

content: 2 and a certain man who had been lame from his mother’s womb was being carried,—whom they used to lay daily at the door of the temple—the door called Beautiful, that he might ask alms of them who were entering into the temple:
content_old: 2 and a certain man who had been lame from his mother’s womb was being carried,—whom they used to lay daily at the door of the temple—the door called Beautiful, that he might ask alms of them who were entering into the temple:

content: 3 who seeing Peter and John about to enter into the temple was requesting to receive an alms.
content_old: 3 who seeing Peter and John about to enter into the temple was requesting to receive an alms.

content: 4 But Peter looking steadfastly at him—with John—said: Look on us!
content_old: 4 But Peter looking steadfastly at him—with John—said: Look on us!

content: 5 And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something from them.
content_old: 5 And he gave heed unto them, expecting to receive something from them.

content: 6 But Peter said— Silver and gold have I none, But what I have the same unto thee do I give:— In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene Walk!
content_old: 6 But Peter said— Silver and gold have I none, But what I have the same unto thee do I give:— In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene Walk!

content: 7 And laying hold of him by the right hand he raised him up; and instantly were his feet and ankles strengthened;—
content_old: 7 And laying hold of him by the right hand he raised him up; and instantly were his feet and ankles strengthened;—

content: 8 and leaping forward he stood､ and walked, and entered with them into the temple walking､ and leaping､ and praising God
content_old: 8 and leaping forward he stood､ and walked, and entered with them into the temple walking､ and leaping､ and praising God

content: 9 And all the people saw him, walking and praising God;
content_old: 9 And all the people saw him, walking and praising God;

content: 10 and they began to recognise him, that the same was he who for the alms used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the temple;—and they were filled with amazement and transport at what had happened unto him.
content_old: 10 and they began to recognise him, that the same was he who for the alms used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the temple;—and they were filled with amazement and transport at what had happened unto him.

content: 11 And as he held fast Peter and John all the people ran together unto them, in the portico which is called Solomon’s,—greatly amazed.
content_old: 11 And as he held fast Peter and John all the people ran together unto them, in the portico which is called Solomon’s,—greatly amazed.

content: 12 And Peter seeing it made answer unto the people:— Ye men of Israel! Why marvel ye at this man? Or upon us why are ye intently looking, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?
content_old: 12 And Peter seeing it made answer unto the people:— Ye men of Israel! Why marvel ye at this man? Or upon us why are ye intently looking, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?

content: 13 The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob,— The God of our fathers Hath glorified his servant Jesus:— Whom ye indeed､ delivered up and denied to Pilate’s face､ When he had adjudged to release him;
content_old: 13 The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob,— The God of our fathers Hath glorified his servant Jesus:— Whom ye indeed､ delivered up and denied to Pilate’s face､ When he had adjudged to release him;

content: 14 But ye denied the Holy and Righteous One, And claimed a man that was a murderer､ to be granted you;
content_old: 14 But ye denied the Holy and Righteous One, And claimed a man that was a murderer､ to be granted you;

content: 15 But the Princely Leader of Life ye slew:— Whom God raised from among the dead, whereof we are witnesses.
content_old: 15 But the Princely Leader of Life ye slew:— Whom God raised from among the dead, whereof we are witnesses.

content: 16 And by the faith of his name Unto this man whom ye see and know hath his name given strength,— Yea the faith which is through him hath given unto him this perfect soundness､ over against you all!
content_old: 16 And by the faith of his name Unto this man whom ye see and know hath his name given strength,— Yea the faith which is through him hath given unto him this perfect soundness､ over against you all!

content: 17 And now brethren, I know that by way of ignorance ye acted,— Just as even your rulers.
content_old: 17 And now brethren, I know that by way of ignorance ye acted,— Just as even your rulers.

content: 18 Howbeit God— what things he had before declared､ through the mouth of all the prophets､ for his Christ to suffer —did thus fulfil!
content_old: 18 Howbeit God— what things he had before declared､ through the mouth of all the prophets､ for his Christ to suffer —did thus fulfil!

content: 19 Repent ye､ therefore, and turn,—unto the blotting out of your sins; To the end that in that case､ there may come seasons of refreshing from the face of the Lord,
content_old: 19 Repent ye､ therefore, and turn,—unto the blotting out of your sins; To the end that in that case､ there may come seasons of refreshing from the face of the Lord,

content: 20 And he may send forth him who had been fore-appointed for you— Christ Jesus:
content_old: 20 And he may send forth him who had been fore-appointed for you— Christ Jesus:

content: 21 Unto whom､ indeed､ heaven must needs give welcome, until the times of the due establishment of all things､ of which God hath spoken through the mouth of his holy age-past prophets.
content_old: 21 Unto whom､ indeed､ heaven must needs give welcome, until the times of the due establishment of all things､ of which God hath spoken through the mouth of his holy age-past prophets.

content: 22 Moses indeed､ said— A prophet unto you shall the Lord God raise up､ from among your brethren､ like unto me: Unto him shall ye hearken､ respecting all things､ whatsoever he shall speak unto you
content_old: 22 Moses indeed､ said— A prophet unto you shall the Lord God raise up､ from among your brethren､ like unto me: Unto him shall ye hearken､ respecting all things､ whatsoever he shall speak unto you

content: 23 And it shall be— Every soul､ whatsoever､ which shall not hearken unto that prophet Shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.
content_old: 23 And it shall be— Every soul､ whatsoever､ which shall not hearken unto that prophet Shall be utterly destroyed from among the people.

content: 24 But､ indeed all the prophets— From Samuel and those following after, as many as have spoken Have even announced these days.
content_old: 24 But､ indeed all the prophets— From Samuel and those following after, as many as have spoken Have even announced these days.

content: 25 Ye are the sons of the prophets､ and of the covenant which God covenanted unto your fathers, saying unto Abraham— And in thy seed shall be blessed､ All the families of the ground.
content_old: 25 Ye are the sons of the prophets､ and of the covenant which God covenanted unto your fathers, saying unto Abraham— And in thy seed shall be blessed､ All the families of the ground.

content: 1 But as they were speaking unto the people the High-priests and the Captain of the temple and the Sadducees､ came upon them,
content_old: 1 But as they were speaking unto the people the High-priests and the Captain of the temple and the Sadducees､ came upon them,

content: 2 being tired out because of their teaching the people､ and announcing in Jesus the resurrection from among the dead;
content_old: 2 being tired out because of their teaching the people､ and announcing in Jesus the resurrection from among the dead;

content: 3 and they thrust on them their hands､ and put them in custody for the morrow, for it was evening already.
content_old: 3 and they thrust on them their hands､ and put them in custody for the morrow, for it was evening already.

content: 4 Howbeit many of them that heard the word believed; and the number of the men became about five thousand.
content_old: 4 Howbeit many of them that heard the word believed; and the number of the men became about five thousand.

content: 5 And it came to pass､ upon the morrow, that there were gathered together of them､ the rulers and the elders and the scribes､ in Jerusalem;
content_old: 5 And it came to pass､ upon the morrow, that there were gathered together of them､ the rulers and the elders and the scribes､ in Jerusalem;

content: 6 also Annas､ the high-priest, and Caiaphas, and John､ and Alexander, and as many as were of high-priestly descent;—
content_old: 6 also Annas､ the high-priest, and Caiaphas, and John､ and Alexander, and as many as were of high-priestly descent;—

content: 7 and setting them in the midst they began to enquire— In what manner of power､ or in what manner of name did ye do this?
content_old: 7 and setting them in the midst they began to enquire— In what manner of power､ or in what manner of name did ye do this?

content: 8 Then Peter､ filled with Holy Spirit said unto them— Ye rulers of the people､ and elders!
content_old: 8 Then Peter､ filled with Holy Spirit said unto them— Ye rulers of the people､ and elders!

content: 9 If we this day､ are to be examined for doing good to a sick man,— In whom this man hath been made well
content_old: 9 If we this day､ are to be examined for doing good to a sick man,— In whom this man hath been made well

content: 10 Be it known unto you all､ and unto all the people of Israel: That in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene,— Whom ye crucified, Whom God raised from among the dead In him doth this man stand by､ in your presence､ whole.
content_old: 10 Be it known unto you all､ and unto all the people of Israel: That in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazarene,— Whom ye crucified, Whom God raised from among the dead In him doth this man stand by､ in your presence､ whole.

content: 11 This is the stone, set at nought by you the builders, Which became the head of the corner;
content_old: 11 This is the stone, set at nought by you the builders, Which became the head of the corner;

content: 12 And there is in no one else salvation, For neither is there any other name under heaven､ Which hath been set forth among men､ In which we must needs be saved.
content_old: 12 And there is in no one else salvation, For neither is there any other name under heaven､ Which hath been set forth among men､ In which we must needs be saved.

content: 13 And looking at Peter’s boldness of speech､ and John’s, and having discovered that they were unlettered and obscure men they began to marvel, recognising them also､ that they had been with Jesus;
content_old: 13 And looking at Peter’s boldness of speech､ and John’s, and having discovered that they were unlettered and obscure men they began to marvel, recognising them also､ that they had been with Jesus;

content: 14 seeing the man also standing with them､ even the man who had been cured they had nothing wherewith to contradict.
content_old: 14 seeing the man also standing with them､ even the man who had been cured they had nothing wherewith to contradict.

content: 15 Howbeit ordering them to go forth outside the high-council they began to confer one with another,
content_old: 15 Howbeit ordering them to go forth outside the high-council they began to confer one with another,

content: 16 saying— What are we to do with these men? For､ indeed､ that a notable sign hath come to pass through their means unto all who are dwelling in Jerusalem is manifest, and we cannot deny it!
content_old: 16 saying— What are we to do with these men? For､ indeed､ that a notable sign hath come to pass through their means unto all who are dwelling in Jerusalem is manifest, and we cannot deny it!

content: 17 Nevertheless lest it further spread abroad among the people let us charge them with threats､ to be no more speaking upon this name to any soul of man.
content_old: 17 Nevertheless lest it further spread abroad among the people let us charge them with threats､ to be no more speaking upon this name to any soul of man.

content: 18 And calling them they gave them the sweeping charge,—Not to be sounding aloud nor even to be teaching upon the name of Jesus.
content_old: 18 And calling them they gave them the sweeping charge,—Not to be sounding aloud nor even to be teaching upon the name of Jesus.

content: 19 But Peter and John answering said unto them— Whether it be right in presence of God Unto you to be hearkening rather than unto God judge!

content: 20 For we cannot but be speaking the things which we have seen and heard!
content_old: 20 For we cannot but be speaking the things which we have seen and heard!

content: 21 They however､ further charging them with threats let them go, finding nothing as to how they might chastise them､ on account of the people; because all were glorifying God for that which had come to pass;—

content: 22 for more than forty years old was the man､ upon whom had taken place this healing sign.
content_old: 22 for more than forty years old was the man､ upon whom had taken place this healing sign.

content: 23 But when they had been let go they came unto their own friends､ and told as many things as unto them the High-priests and Elders had said.

content: 24 And they､ having heard with one accord uplifted a voice unto God, and said— O Sovereign! Thou art he that made the heaven､ and the earthy､ and the sea, and all things that are therein:

content: 25 Who by our father､ through means of the Holy Spirit､ even by the mouth of David thy servant said— Unto what end did nations rage, And peoples busy themselves with empty things?

content: 27 For they were gathered together､ of a truth, in this city, against thy holy servant Jesus､ whom thou hadst anointed,—both Herod､ and Pontius Pilate, with them of the nations､ and peoples of Israel;—

content: 28 to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel marked out beforehand to come to pass.

content: 29 As to the present things､ then､ O Lord,—Look upon their threats, and grant unto thy servants with all freedom of utterance to be speaking thy word,

content: 30 by stretching forth thy hand for healing､ and by the coming to pass of both signs and wonders through the name of thy holy servant Jesus.

content: 32 And the throng of them that believed had one heart and soul, and not so much as one was saying that aught of his goods was his own, but they had all things common.

content: 1 But a certain man､ Ananias by name, with Sapphira his wife sold a possession､

content: 2 and kept back part of the price, his wife also being privy to it; and bringing a certain part at the feet of the Apostles he laid it.

content_old: 3 But Peter said— Ananias! wherefore did Satan fill thy heart, that thou shouldst deal falsely with the Holy Spirit､ and keep back part of the price of the field?

content: 4 While it remained was it not as thine own it remained? and when sold was it not in thine own authority that it still continued? Why was it that thou didst contrive in thy heart this deed? Thou hast not dealt falsely with men but with God.

content: 21 Now when they heard this they entered､ under the dawn､ into the temple, and began teaching. And the High-priest and they who were with him arriving called together the high-council､ and all the senate of the sons of Israel; and sent off unto the prison､ to have them brought.

content: 5 and gave him no inheritance therein, not even a place to set his foot on; and yet promised to give it unto him in possession､ and unto his seed after him, when as yet he had not a child.

content: 4 They､ therefore､ being sent forth by the Holy Spirit went down unto Seleucia, and from thence sailed away unto Cyprus;
content_old: 4 They､ therefore､ being sent forth by the Holy Spirit went down unto Seleucia, and from thence sailed away unto Cyprus;

content: 5 and､ coming to be in Salamis､ they declared the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews;—and they had John also as an attendant.
content_old: 5 and､ coming to be in Salamis､ they declared the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews;—and they had John also as an attendant.

content: 6 And passing through the whole island､ as far as Paphos they found a certain man､ a magician､ a false-prophet､ a Jew, whose name was Barjesus;
content_old: 6 And passing through the whole island､ as far as Paphos they found a certain man､ a magician､ a false-prophet､ a Jew, whose name was Barjesus;

content: 7 who was with the proconsul､ Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. The same calling for Barnabas and Saul sought to hear the word of God.
content_old: 7 who was with the proconsul､ Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. The same calling for Barnabas and Saul sought to hear the word of God.

content: 8 But Elymas the magician,—for so､ when translated､ is his name,—withstood them; seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.
content_old: 8 But Elymas the magician,—for so､ when translated､ is his name,—withstood them; seeking to turn aside the proconsul from the faith.

content: 9 But Saul who is also Paul filled with Holy Spirit､ looking steadfastly at him
content_old: 9 But Saul who is also Paul filled with Holy Spirit､ looking steadfastly at him

content: 10 said— O full of all guile､ and all recklessness! Son of an adversary! Enemy of all righteousness!— Wilt thou not cease to pervert the straight ways of the Lord?
content_old: 10 said— O full of all guile､ and all recklessness! Son of an adversary! Enemy of all righteousness!— Wilt thou not cease to pervert the straight ways of the Lord?

content: 11 Now therefore､ lo! the hand of the Lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind､ not seeing the sun, until a fitting time. And instantly there fell upon him a mist and darkness; and going about he was seeking such as might lead him by the hand.

content: 12 Then the proconsul seeing what had happened believed, being amazed at the teaching of the Lord.
content_old: 12 Then the proconsul seeing what had happened believed, being amazed at the teaching of the Lord.

content: 13 And setting sail from Paphos Paul’s company came into Perga of Pamphylia; but John withdrawing from them returned unto Jerusalem.
content_old: 13 And setting sail from Paphos Paul’s company came into Perga of Pamphylia; but John withdrawing from them returned unto Jerusalem.

content: 14 They however､ passing through from Perga arrived at Antioch of Pisidia; and going into the synagogue on the sabbath-day sat down.
content_old: 14 They however､ passing through from Perga arrived at Antioch of Pisidia; and going into the synagogue on the sabbath-day sat down.

content: 15 And after the reading of the law and the prophets the synagogue-rulers sent unto them, saying— Brethren! if there is in you a word of exhortation unto the people say on.
content_old: 15 And after the reading of the law and the prophets the synagogue-rulers sent unto them, saying— Brethren! if there is in you a word of exhortation unto the people say on.

content: 16 And Paul standing up and making a sign with his hand said— Ye men of Israel! and such as revere God! hearken:—
content_old: 16 And Paul standing up and making a sign with his hand said— Ye men of Israel! and such as revere God! hearken:—

content: 17 The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and the people he exalted､ by their sojourn in the land of Egypt,—and with a high arm brought he them out of it;
content_old: 17 The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and the people he exalted､ by their sojourn in the land of Egypt,—and with a high arm brought he them out of it;

content: 18 and for the time of about forty years bare with their manners in the desert;
content_old: 18 and for the time of about forty years bare with their manners in the desert;

content: 19 and overthrowing seven nations in the land of Canaan gave them their land as an inheritance—about four hundred and fifty years.
content_old: 19 and overthrowing seven nations in the land of Canaan gave them their land as an inheritance—about four hundred and fifty years.

content: 20 And after these things he gave them judges､ until Samuel the prophet.
content_old: 20 And after these things he gave them judges､ until Samuel the prophet.

content: 21 And from that time they asked for themselves a king, and God gave them Saul､ son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin､ during forty years;
content_old: 21 And from that time they asked for themselves a king, and God gave them Saul､ son of Kish, a man of the tribe of Benjamin､ during forty years;

content: 22 and setting him aside raised up David unto them for king,—Of whom he also said bearing witness— I have found David､ the son of Jesse,— A man according to my heart, Who will do all my will.
content_old: 22 and setting him aside raised up David unto them for king,—Of whom he also said bearing witness— I have found David､ the son of Jesse,— A man according to my heart, Who will do all my will.

content: 23 From this man’s seed hath God according to promise brought unto Israel､ a saviour—Jesus:
content_old: 23 From this man’s seed hath God according to promise brought unto Israel､ a saviour—Jesus:

content: 24 John beforehand proclaiming before the face of his coming in､ an immersion of repentance, unto all the people of Israel.
content_old: 24 John beforehand proclaiming before the face of his coming in､ an immersion of repentance, unto all the people of Israel.

content: 25 And as John was fulfilling his course he was saying— Whom are ye supposing that I am? I am not he! But lo! there cometh､ after me､ One of whom I am not worthy the sandals of his feet to loosen.
content_old: 25 And as John was fulfilling his course he was saying— Whom are ye supposing that I am? I am not he! But lo! there cometh､ after me､ One of whom I am not worthy the sandals of his feet to loosen.

content: 26 Brethren! sons of the race of Abraham, and those who among you revere God,—unto you hath this word of salvation been sent forth.
content_old: 26 Brethren! sons of the race of Abraham, and those who among you revere God,—unto you hath this word of salvation been sent forth.

content: 27 For they who were dwelling in Jerusalem, and their rulers not recognising him have､ by judging him､ fulfilled the very voices of the prophets which every sabbath are being read;
content_old: 27 For they who were dwelling in Jerusalem, and their rulers not recognising him have､ by judging him､ fulfilled the very voices of the prophets which every sabbath are being read;

content: 28 and though no single cause of death they found yet claimed they of Pilate that he should be slain.
content_old: 28 and though no single cause of death they found yet claimed they of Pilate that he should be slain.

content: 29 And when they had finished all those things which concerning him had been written taking him down from the tree they put him in a tomb.
content_old: 29 And when they had finished all those things which concerning him had been written taking him down from the tree they put him in a tomb.

content: 30 But God raised him from among the dead:
content_old: 30 But God raised him from among the dead:

content: 31 Who appeared､ during many days､ unto them who had come up with him from Galilee unto Jerusalem; who､ indeed､ now are his witnesses unto the people.
content_old: 31 Who appeared､ during many days､ unto them who had come up with him from Galilee unto Jerusalem; who､ indeed､ now are his witnesses unto the people.

content: 32 We therefore､ unto you bring the good news､ as to the promise which unto our fathers was made,—
content_old: 32 We therefore､ unto you bring the good news､ as to the promise which unto our fathers was made,—

content: 33 That God hath fulfilled the same for our children, by raising up Jesus: As also in the second psalm it is written— My son art thou: I this day have begotten thee.
content_old: 33 That God hath fulfilled the same for our children, by raising up Jesus: As also in the second psalm it is written— My son art thou: I this day have begotten thee.

content: 34 And in that he raised him from among the dead, no more destined to return unto corruption on this wise hath he spoken— I will give unto you the faithful lovingkindnesses of David.
content_old: 34 And in that he raised him from among the dead, no more destined to return unto corruption on this wise hath he spoken— I will give unto you the faithful lovingkindnesses of David.

content: 35 Wherefore also in a different place he saith— Thou wilt not give thy man of lovingkindness to see corruption.
content_old: 35 Wherefore also in a different place he saith— Thou wilt not give thy man of lovingkindness to see corruption.

content: 36 For David indeed､ unto his own generation having done service､ by the counsel of God fell asleep, and was added unto his fathers､ and saw corruption;
content_old: 36 For David indeed､ unto his own generation having done service､ by the counsel of God fell asleep, and was added unto his fathers､ and saw corruption;

content: 37 But he whom God hath raised did not see corruption.
content_old: 37 But he whom God hath raised did not see corruption.

content: 38 Be it known unto you､ therefore､ brethren,—That through this man unto you remission of sins is declared;
content_old: 38 Be it known unto you､ therefore､ brethren,—That through this man unto you remission of sins is declared;

content: 39 and from all things from which ye could not by the law of Moses be justified by this man everyone that believeth is justified.
content_old: 39 and from all things from which ye could not by the law of Moses be justified by this man everyone that believeth is justified.

content: 40 Be taking heed､ therefore､ lest that come upon you which hath been spoken in the prophets—
content_old: 40 Be taking heed､ therefore､ lest that come upon you which hath been spoken in the prophets—

content: 41 See, ye despisers, and marvel､ and disappear: In that a work am I working in your days,— A work which in nowise will ye believe､ Though one relate it in full unto you.
content_old: 41 See, ye despisers, and marvel､ and disappear: In that a work am I working in your days,— A work which in nowise will ye believe､ Though one relate it in full unto you.

content: 42 And as they were going out they kept on beseeching that on the ensuing sabbath might be spoken unto them these things.
content_old: 42 And as they were going out they kept on beseeching that on the ensuing sabbath might be spoken unto them these things.

content: 43 And when the congregation was broken up there followed many of the Jews､ and of the devout proselytes, with Paul and Barnabas; who､ indeed､ in speaking unto them went on persuading them to abide in the favour of God.
content_old: 43 And when the congregation was broken up there followed many of the Jews､ and of the devout proselytes, with Paul and Barnabas; who､ indeed､ in speaking unto them went on persuading them to abide in the favour of God.

content: 44 And on the coming sabbath almost all the city was gathered together､ to hear the word of God.
content_old: 44 And on the coming sabbath almost all the city was gathered together､ to hear the word of God.

content: 45 But the Jews seeing the multitudes were filled with jealousy,—and began speaking against the things which by Paul were being spoken, defaming them.
content_old: 45 But the Jews seeing the multitudes were filled with jealousy,—and began speaking against the things which by Paul were being spoken, defaming them.

content: 46 And Paul and Barnabas speaking boldly said— Unto you was it necessary､ that the word of God should first be spoken: Seeing ye are thrusting it from you, and unworthy are judging yourselves of the age-abiding life lo! we turn unto the nations;
content_old: 46 And Paul and Barnabas speaking boldly said— Unto you was it necessary､ that the word of God should first be spoken: Seeing ye are thrusting it from you, and unworthy are judging yourselves of the age-abiding life lo! we turn unto the nations;

content: 47 for so hath the Lord commanded us— I have set thee for a light of nations, That thou mayest be for salvation unto the end of the earth.
content_old: 47 for so hath the Lord commanded us— I have set thee for a light of nations, That thou mayest be for salvation unto the end of the earth.

content: 48 And they of the nations hearing this began to rejoice､ and to be glorifying God, and they believed—as many as had become disposed for life age-abiding.
content_old: 48 And they of the nations hearing this began to rejoice､ and to be glorifying God, and they believed—as many as had become disposed for life age-abiding.

content: 49 And the word of the Lord went on to be carried through the whole country.
content_old: 49 And the word of the Lord went on to be carried through the whole country.

content: 50 But the Jews urged on the devout women of the higher class､ and the chief men of the city, and roused up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas,—and thrust them out from their bounds.
content_old: 50 But the Jews urged on the devout women of the higher class､ and the chief men of the city, and roused up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas,—and thrust them out from their bounds.

content: 51 But they shaking off the dust of their feet against them came into Iconium.
content_old: 51 But they shaking off the dust of their feet against them came into Iconium.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ in Iconium､ that they together entered into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake､ that there believed､ both of Jews and Greeks､ a great throng.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ in Iconium､ that they together entered into the synagogue of the Jews, and so spake､ that there believed､ both of Jews and Greeks､ a great throng.

content: 2 But the un-persuaded Jews roused up and provoked the souls of them of the nations against the brethren.
content_old: 2 But the un-persuaded Jews roused up and provoked the souls of them of the nations against the brethren.

content: 3 A good while､ therefore､ tarried they using boldness of speech in dependence upon the Lord､ who was bearing witness unto his word of favour, granting signs and wonders to be coming to pass through their hands.
content_old: 3 A good while､ therefore､ tarried they using boldness of speech in dependence upon the Lord､ who was bearing witness unto his word of favour, granting signs and wonders to be coming to pass through their hands.

content: 4 And the throng of the city was divided; and some indeed were with the Jews, while some were with the apostles.
content_old: 4 And the throng of the city was divided; and some indeed were with the Jews, while some were with the apostles.

content: 5 But when there took place an assault both of them of the nations and of the Jews､ with their rulers､ to maltreat and to stone them
content_old: 5 But when there took place an assault both of them of the nations and of the Jews､ with their rulers､ to maltreat and to stone them

content: 6 they became aware of it, and fled unto the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding country;
content_old: 6 they became aware of it, and fled unto the cities of Lycaonia, Lystra and Derbe, and the surrounding country;

content: 7 and there were they announcing the glad tidings.
content_old: 7 and there were they announcing the glad tidings.

content: 8 And a certain man in Lystra､ impotent in his feet was sitting,—lame from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.
content_old: 8 And a certain man in Lystra､ impotent in his feet was sitting,—lame from his mother’s womb, who never had walked.

content: 9 This man hearkened unto Paul､ as he was speaking,—who looking steadfastly at him､ and seeing he had faith to be made well
content_old: 9 This man hearkened unto Paul､ as he was speaking,—who looking steadfastly at him､ and seeing he had faith to be made well

content: 10 said､ with a loud voice— Stand up on thy feet､ erect! And he sprang up､ and began to walk about.
content_old: 10 said､ with a loud voice— Stand up on thy feet､ erect! And he sprang up､ and began to walk about.

content: 11 And the multitudes seeing what Paul had done lifted up their voice､ in the speech of Lycaonia— The gods, made like unto men have come down unto us!
content_old: 11 And the multitudes seeing what Paul had done lifted up their voice､ in the speech of Lycaonia— The gods, made like unto men have come down unto us!

content: 12 And they went on to call Barnabas､ Jupiter, and Paul､ Mercury, seeing that he was the leader of discourse.
content_old: 12 And they went on to call Barnabas､ Jupiter, and Paul､ Mercury, seeing that he was the leader of discourse.

content: 13 Also the priest of the Jupiter that was before the city bringing bulls and garlands unto the gates with the multitudes would have offered sacrifice.
content_old: 13 Also the priest of the Jupiter that was before the city bringing bulls and garlands unto the gates with the multitudes would have offered sacrifice.

content: 14 But the apostles Barnabas and Paul､ hearing of it､ rending asunder their own mantles､ sprang forward amidst the multitude, crying aloud､
content_old: 14 But the apostles Barnabas and Paul､ hearing of it､ rending asunder their own mantles､ sprang forward amidst the multitude, crying aloud､

content: 15 and saying— Men! why these things are ye doing? We also of like nature with you are men, bringing you the good news､ that from these vain things ye should be turning unto a living God:— Who made heaven and the earth and the sea and all things therein;
content_old: 15 and saying— Men! why these things are ye doing? We also of like nature with you are men, bringing you the good news､ that from these vain things ye should be turning unto a living God:— Who made heaven and the earth and the sea and all things therein;

content: 16 Who in the bygone generations suffered all the nations to be going on in their own ways,—
content_old: 16 Who in the bygone generations suffered all the nations to be going on in their own ways,—

content: 17 Although not without witness he left himself, doing good, From heaven upon you giving rain and fruitful seasons, Filling with food and gladness your hearts.
content_old: 17 Although not without witness he left himself, doing good, From heaven upon you giving rain and fruitful seasons, Filling with food and gladness your hearts.

content: 18 Even these things saying､ scarcely restrained they the multitudes from offering sacrifice unto them.

content: 19 But there came thither､ from Antioch and Iconium､ Jews, and persuading the multitudes､ and stoning Paul they dragged him outside the city, supposing him to be dead.
content_old: 19 But there came thither､ from Antioch and Iconium､ Jews, and persuading the multitudes､ and stoning Paul they dragged him outside the city, supposing him to be dead.

content: 20 Howbeit､ the disciples surrounding him he rose up､ and entered into the city. And on the morrow he went forth､ with Barnabas､ unto Derbe.
content_old: 20 Howbeit､ the disciples surrounding him he rose up､ and entered into the city. And on the morrow he went forth､ with Barnabas､ unto Derbe.

content: 21 Delivering the good news unto that city also､ and making a good number of disciples they returned unto Lystra､ and unto Iconium�� and unto Antioch,—
content_old: 21 Delivering the good news unto that city also､ and making a good number of disciples they returned unto Lystra､ and unto Iconium�� and unto Antioch,—

content: 22 confirming the souls of the disciples, beseeching them to abide in the faith, and declaring that Through many tribulations must we enter into the kingdom of God.
content_old: 22 confirming the souls of the disciples, beseeching them to abide in the faith, and declaring that Through many tribulations must we enter into the kingdom of God.

content: 23 Moreover appointing unto them by vote､ in each assembly､ elders, praying with fastings they commended them unto the Lord on whom they had believed.
content_old: 23 Moreover appointing unto them by vote､ in each assembly､ elders, praying with fastings they commended them unto the Lord on whom they had believed.

content: 24 And passing through Pisidia they came into Pamphylia;
content_old: 24 And passing through Pisidia they came into Pamphylia;

content: 25 and speaking in Perga the word they came down unto Attalia;
content_old: 25 and speaking in Perga the word they came down unto Attalia;

content: 26 and from thence they set sail for Antioch, whence they had been given up unto the favour of God for the work which they had fulfilled.
content_old: 26 and from thence they set sail for Antioch, whence they had been given up unto the favour of God for the work which they had fulfilled.

content: 27 And when they had arrived and gathered together the assembly they began recounting how many things God had done with them, and that he had opened unto the nations a door of faith.
content_old: 27 And when they had arrived and gathered together the assembly they began recounting how many things God had done with them, and that he had opened unto the nations a door of faith.

content: 1 And certain persons coming down from Judæa began to teach the brethren— Except ye be circumcised according to the custom of Moses ye cannot be saved.
content_old: 1 And certain persons coming down from Judæa began to teach the brethren— Except ye be circumcised according to the custom of Moses ye cannot be saved.

content: 2 And when Paul and Barnabas had had no little dissension and discussion with them it was arranged､ that Paul and Barnabas and certain others from among them should go up unto the Apostles and Elders in Jerusalem､ concerning this question.
content_old: 2 And when Paul and Barnabas had had no little dissension and discussion with them it was arranged､ that Paul and Barnabas and certain others from among them should go up unto the Apostles and Elders in Jerusalem､ concerning this question.

content: 3 They､ therefore､ being set forward by the Assembly began passing through Phænicia and Samaria､ fully relating the conversion of them of the nations, and were causing great joy unto all the brethren.
content_old: 3 They､ therefore､ being set forward by the Assembly began passing through Phænicia and Samaria､ fully relating the conversion of them of the nations, and were causing great joy unto all the brethren.

content: 4 And having arrived in Jerusalem they were welcomed by the Assembly and the Apostles and the Elders; and they recounted all things God had done with them.
content_old: 4 And having arrived in Jerusalem they were welcomed by the Assembly and the Apostles and the Elders; and they recounted all things God had done with them.

content: 5 But there had stood forth some of those who from the sect of Pharisees had believed, saying— It is needful to be circumcising them, also to charge them to be keeping the law of Moses.
content_old: 5 But there had stood forth some of those who from the sect of Pharisees had believed, saying— It is needful to be circumcising them, also to charge them to be keeping the law of Moses.

content: 6 And the Apostles and Elders were gathered together to see about this matter.
content_old: 6 And the Apostles and Elders were gathered together to see about this matter.

content: 7 And when much discussion had arisen Peter standing up, said unto them— Brethren! Ye yourselves well know that in days long past amongst you God chose that through my mouth the nations should hear the word of the glad tidings, and believe.
content_old: 7 And when much discussion had arisen Peter standing up, said unto them— Brethren! Ye yourselves well know that in days long past amongst you God chose that through my mouth the nations should hear the word of the glad tidings, and believe.

content: 8 And the heart-observing God bare witness,—unto them giving the Holy Spirit､ just as even unto us;
content_old: 8 And the heart-observing God bare witness,—unto them giving the Holy Spirit､ just as even unto us;

content: 9 and made no distinction at all betwixt us and them, by their faith purifying their hearts.
content_old: 9 and made no distinction at all betwixt us and them, by their faith purifying their hearts.

content: 10 Now therefore､ why are ye proving God, that ye should put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples､ which neither our fathers､ nor we have been able to bear.
content_old: 10 Now therefore､ why are ye proving God, that ye should put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples､ which neither our fathers､ nor we have been able to bear.

content: 11 But through the favour of the Lord Jesus we believe we shall be saved､ in like manner as even they.
content_old: 11 But through the favour of the Lord Jesus we believe we shall be saved､ in like manner as even they.

content: 12 And all the throng held their peace, and began to hearken unto Barnabas and Paul relating how many signs and wonders God had done among the nations through them.
content_old: 12 And all the throng held their peace, and began to hearken unto Barnabas and Paul relating how many signs and wonders God had done among the nations through them.

content: 13 And after they held their peace James answered､ saying— Brethren! hearken unto me.
content_old: 13 And after they held their peace James answered､ saying— Brethren! hearken unto me.

content: 14 Symeon hath fully told how God first visited､ to take out of the nations, a people for his name.
content_old: 14 Symeon hath fully told how God first visited､ to take out of the nations, a people for his name.

content: 15 And with this agree the words of the prophets, according as it is written—
content_old: 15 And with this agree the words of the prophets, according as it is written—

content: 16 After these things will I return､ And will rebuild the tent of David that hath fallen, And the ruins thereof will I rebuild､ And will set it up again:
content_old: 16 After these things will I return､ And will rebuild the tent of David that hath fallen, And the ruins thereof will I rebuild､ And will set it up again:

content: 17 That the residues of men may seek out the Lord, And all the nations upon whom my name hath been called, Saith the Lord that doeth these things､
content_old: 17 That the residues of men may seek out the Lord, And all the nations upon whom my name hath been called, Saith the Lord that doeth these things､

content: 18 Known from age-past times.
content_old: 18 Known from age-past times.

content: 19 Wherefore I judge､ not to be troubling them who from the nations are turning unto God;
content_old: 19 Wherefore I judge､ not to be troubling them who from the nations are turning unto God;

content: 20 but to write unto them､ To abstain from the pollutions of idols, And from fornication, And from what is strangled, And from blood.
content_old: 20 but to write unto them､ To abstain from the pollutions of idols, And from fornication, And from what is strangled, And from blood.

content: 21 For Moses out of ancient generations hath in every city them who proclaim him; seeing that in the synagogues every sabbath he is read.
content_old: 21 For Moses out of ancient generations hath in every city them who proclaim him; seeing that in the synagogues every sabbath he is read.

content: 22 Then seemed it good､ unto the Apostles and the Elders with the whole Assembly､ to send chosen men from among them unto Antioch､ with Paul and Barnabas,—even Judas who is called Barsabbas, and Silas, men taking a lead among the brethren:
content_old: 22 Then seemed it good､ unto the Apostles and the Elders with the whole Assembly､ to send chosen men from among them unto Antioch､ with Paul and Barnabas,—even Judas who is called Barsabbas, and Silas, men taking a lead among the brethren:

content: 23 writing through their hand— The Apostles and the Elder Brethren unto the brethren throughout Antioch and Syria and Cilicia who are from among the nations wish joy!
content_old: 23 writing through their hand— The Apostles and the Elder Brethren unto the brethren throughout Antioch and Syria and Cilicia who are from among the nations wish joy!

content: 24 Inasmuch as we had heard that certain from among us had troubled you with words, dismantling your souls,—unto whom we had given no instructions
content_old: 24 Inasmuch as we had heard that certain from among us had troubled you with words, dismantling your souls,—unto whom we had given no instructions

content: 25 It seemed good unto us coming to be of one accord, that we should choose men and send them unto you､ with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,—
content_old: 25 It seemed good unto us coming to be of one accord, that we should choose men and send them unto you､ with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,—

content: 26 men who have given up their lives in behalf of the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 26 men who have given up their lives in behalf of the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 27 We have sent､ therefore､ Judas and Silas, who also themselves by word of mouth can tell you the same things.
content_old: 27 We have sent､ therefore､ Judas and Silas, who also themselves by word of mouth can tell you the same things.

content: 28 For it hath seemed good unto the Holy Spirit､ and unto us no greater burden to be laying upon you､ than these necessary things:—
content_old: 28 For it hath seemed good unto the Holy Spirit､ and unto us no greater burden to be laying upon you､ than these necessary things:—

content: 29 To be abstaining from idol sacrifices, And from blood, And from what is strangled, And from fornication,— From which if ye keep yourselves ye shall prosper. Fare ye well.
content_old: 29 To be abstaining from idol sacrifices, And from blood, And from what is strangled, And from fornication,— From which if ye keep yourselves ye shall prosper. Fare ye well.

content: 30 They､ therefore､ being let go came down unto Antioch; and having gathered together the throng delivered the letter,
content_old: 30 They､ therefore､ being let go came down unto Antioch; and having gathered together the throng delivered the letter,

content: 31 and when they read it they rejoiced for the consolation.
content_old: 31 and when they read it they rejoiced for the consolation.

content: 32 And both Judas and Silas being themselves also prophets with much discourse consoled and confirmed the brethren.
content_old: 32 And both Judas and Silas being themselves also prophets with much discourse consoled and confirmed the brethren.

content: 33 And when they had spent a time they were let go､ in peace､ from the brethren, unto them who had sent them.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ while Apollos was in Corinth Paul passing through the upper parts､ came to Ephesus, and found certain disciples;

content_old: 3 And he said— Into what then､ were ye immersed? And they said— Into John’s immersion.

content_old: 4 Then said Paul— John immersed with an immersion of repentance, unto the people saying､ That on him who was coming after him they should believe,—that is､ on Jesus.

content_old: 6 and Paul laying hands upon them the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they began speaking with tongues and prophesying.

content: 15 But the wicked spirit､ answering､ said unto them— Jesus indeed I am getting to know､ and Paul I well-know,—but who are ye?
content_old: 15 But the wicked spirit､ answering､ said unto them— Jesus indeed I am getting to know､ and Paul I well-know,—but who are ye?

content: 19 And a good many of them who had practised the curious arts bringing together the books were burning them before all; and they reckoned up the prices of them, and found them fifty thousand pieces of silver.

content: 21 Now when these things were fulfilled Paul purposed in his spirit､ going through Macedonia､ and Achaia to be journeying unto Jerusalem, saying— After I have been there Rome also must I see!

content: 24 For one Demetrius by name, a silversmith､ making silver shrines, of Diana used to bring unto the craftsmen no little business;

content: 25 gathering whom together､ and them who in such things wrought he said— Men! ye well know that by this business we have our prosperity;
content_old: 25 gathering whom together､ and them who in such things wrought he said— Men! ye well know that by this business we have our prosperity;

content: 26 and ye perceive and hear that not only in Ephesus､ but well-nigh in all Asia this Paul hath persuaded and turned away a considerable multitude, saying that they are no gods which with hands are made.
content_old: 26 and ye perceive and hear that not only in Ephesus､ but well-nigh in all Asia this Paul hath persuaded and turned away a considerable multitude, saying that they are no gods which with hands are made.

content: 27 And not only is there danger､ that this our heritage into ill-repute may come but even that the temple of the great Goddess Diana for nothing may be counted; also that even on the point of being pulled down may be Her Majesty, whom all Asia and the habitable world do worship.
content_old: 27 And not only is there danger､ that this our heritage into ill-repute may come but even that the temple of the great Goddess Diana for nothing may be counted; also that even on the point of being pulled down may be Her Majesty, whom all Asia and the habitable world do worship.

content_old: 28 Now hearing this､ and becoming full of wrath they began crying aloud, saying— Great is Diana of the Ephesians!

content: 33 Howbeit out of the multitude they bare aloft one Alexander, the Jews thrusting him forward; Alexander however waving his hand was wishing to make his defence unto the populace.

content: 35 Howbeit the town-clerk having calmed the multitude saith— Ephesians! Why､ who is there of mankind､ that doth not acknowledge the city of Ephesians to be temple-keeper of the Great Diana, and of the image that fell from Jupiter?

content: 37 For ye have brought these men, neither as temple-robbers､ nor as defaming our goddess.

content: 38 If then Demetrius､ and the craftsmen with him have against anyone an accusation courts are being held､ and there are proconsuls: let them accuse one another!

content: 40 For we are even in danger of being accused of riot concerning this day, no cause at all existing､ by reference to which we shall be able to give a reason for this concourse.

content: 20 in what manner I in nowise shrank from announcing unto you anything that was profitable and teaching you publicly and in your homes;

content_old: 21 bearing full witness､ both to Jews and to Greeks､ as to the repentance due unto God, and as to belief on our Lord Jesus.

content: 24 But for no cause whatever am I making my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my course､ and the ministry which I have received from the Lord Jesus, to bear full witness as to the good news of the favour of God.
content_old: 24 But for no cause whatever am I making my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my course､ and the ministry which I have received from the Lord Jesus, to bear full witness as to the good news of the favour of God.

content_old: 27 for I have not shrunk from announcing all the counsel of God unto you.

content_old: 3 And sighting Cyprus, and leaving it behind to the left we held on our voyage to Syria, and landed at Tyre; for there the ship was to discharge her cargo.

content_old: 5 And when it came to pass that we had completed the days we went forth､ and continued our journey, all of them accompanying us､ with wives and children, as far as outside the city; and kneeling down on the beach in prayer
